title: Solved Mysteries; or, Revelations of a City Detective
author: Macgovan, James.
snippet: Not far from the little strips of garden attached tothe cottages there was a marshy field, and it was clear to methat the footsteps of the thieves crossed that field. The fieldwas a quick cut towards the Bonnington Road, therefore aquieter way of getting off with the plunder. None but a thiefwould have put a foot in that field unless he wished to leavehis boots and stockings behind him.

title: Skagboys
author: Welsh, Irvine
snippet: As ah gits oaf the bus back at Leith, the last gadgie ah expect tae seein a tracky, poundin the windswept boulevards ay the fair port, is SecondPrize. — Hey, Rab, man, ah goes as the cat comes hoppin intae view oanBonnington Road.

title: Skagboys
author: Welsh, Irvine
snippet: Renton reflecting thatno matter how early you rise or how late you turn in, you never see thatpoint where light begins or the first bruise of darkness bleeds in underits fragile skin; the beauty, and the scary, unfathomable wisdom of transition. They head out from the lock-up in Matty's van, stopping at theCanasta Cafe in Bonnington Road, ostensibly for some food, but reallyto dispense the Valium that Renton liberated from his mother's medicinecabinet. They wash the pills down with milky coffees.
